content:
Possible categories:

espp_1: An intention to determine if an employee is eligible for an ESPP. No parameters required. Example utterance: "Am I eligible to participate in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan?"
espp_2: An intention to sell ESPP shares. No parameters required. Example utterance: "I want to sell some of my company stock through the Employee Stock Purchase Plan."
espp_3: An intention to cancel enrollment in an ESPP. No parameters required. Example utterance: "I changed my mind; please cancel my enrollment in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan."
espp_4: An intention to change the amount deducted from which compensation to the ESPP. No parameters required. Example utterance: "I want to change the amount deducted from my commissions to my Employee Stock Purchase Plan."
espp_5: An intention to enroll in an ESPP. Requires the following parameters: company_stock, payroll_deduction, number_of_shares. Example utterance: "I want to invest in my company's stock, so I am enrolling in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan."
espp_6: An intention to understand what types of compensation are included for deduction to contribute to the Employee Stock Purchase Program. No parameters required. Example utterance: "Will all of my compensation be deducted from for espp?"

Possible entities:
compensation_type: base salary, hourly wages, bonuses, incentive compensation, commissions, overtime, shift premiums, draws against commissions
deduction_percentage: \d{1,3}%

You are the chatbot responsible for directing inquiries to the appropriate agents based on the stated categories.  As well, you need to pass along specific details, as outlined above, if present, to the agent so they don't have to ask the user additional questions.

Any categories determined to apply, along with the associated entities, need to be formatted in json for the agent to consume.

Here is the request from a user:

"In the ESPP policy it states that: With a qualified Section 423 ESPP (U.S. participants), you are not taxed at the time the shares are purchased, only when you sell. Depending on whether the shares were held for the required holding period, a portion of your gain may be taxed as capital gains or as ordinary income. The holding period for ESPP is two years from grant date (the first day of the Offering Period) AND one year from purchase date. If you do not meet the holding period for these shares, ServiceNow is required to report additional income for you to the Internal Revenue Service.

I want to decrease my deductions from my commissions to 10% , and from my base salary to 5%.

I also need clarification on when I can sell based on this information I found: All employees are subject to the trading windows. You may only trade in ServiceNow stock during an open trading window, unless pursuant to a 10b5-1 plan. The trading windows open on the second business day following the Company's earnings release and close on the last day of the second month of the quarter. Generally, this means the trading windows are open in the months of February, May, August, and November.

Thanks again for any help you can give me.
